Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Snide \Snide\, a. 1. Tricky; deceptive; contemptible; as, a snide lawyer; snide goods. [Slang, archaic] [1913 Webster]
2. derogatory in an insinuating manner; as, a snide remark. [PJC]

snide adj : expressive of contempt; "curled his lip in a supercilious smile"; "spoke in a sneering jeering manner"; "makes many a sharp comparison but never a mean or snide one" [syn: {supercilious}, {sneering}]
